page.title: 05FARM ANIMALS - STAMBOURNE
page.content: {BEEF CATTLE:}Mainly Friesian with a few Charolais & Hereford. Bought through a dealer at a week old for approx. Â£90.00. Fed 'ad lib' rolled barley & barley straw, plus some protein concentrate. Kept for 10-11 months inside or 15 months outside, then sold, usually direct to slaughter house but occasionally to market at Bury St.Edmunds or Cambridge. {PIGS:}Large White & Welsh. Farmers breed their own pigs and sell them as weaners at 12 weeks for fattening. They are fed 'ad lib' ground barley plus protein supplement and some wheat {SHEEP:}Masham, Suffolk & Texel. About 200 ewes kept. Fed on grass and oats. The lambs are kept for 4-9 months, then sold either to market or direct to a slaughterhouse.
